org.pcap4j.core

Class PcapHandle

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pcap4j.core.PcapHandle

  • public final class PcapHandle
extends Object
    A wrapper class for struct pcap_t.
    Since:
    pcap4j 0.9.1
    Author:
    Kaito Yamada

        public Integer getTimestampMicros()
        Returns:

      • loop

        public void loop(int packetCount,
        PacketListener listener)
          throws PcapNativeException,
                 InterruptedException,
                 NotOpenException
        A wrapper method for int pcap_loop(pcap_t *, int, pcap_handler, u_char *). When a packet is captured, listener.gotPacket(Packet) is called in the thread which called the loop(). And then this PcapHandle waits for the thread to return from the gotPacket() before it retrieves the next packet from the pcap capture buffer.
        Parameters:
        packetCount -
        listener -
        Throws:
        PcapNativeException
        InterruptedException
        NotOpenException

      • loop

        public void loop(int packetCount,
        PacketListener listener,
        Executor executor)
          throws PcapNativeException,
                 InterruptedException,
                 NotOpenException
        A wrapper method for int pcap_loop(pcap_t *, int, pcap_handler, u_char *). When a packet is captured, the executor.execute() is called with a Runnable object in the thread which called the loop(). Then, the Runnable object calls listener.gotPacket(Packet). If listener.gotPacket(Packet) is expected to take a long time to process a packet, this method should be used with a proper executor instead of loop(int, PacketListener) in order to prevent the pcap capture buffer from overflowing.
        Parameters:
        packetCount -
        listener -
        executor -
        Throws:
        PcapNativeException
        InterruptedException
        NotOpenException

        public PcapDumper dumpOpen(String filePath)
                    throws PcapNativeException,
                           NotOpenException
        Parameters:

      • breakLoop

        public void breakLoop()
               throws NotOpenException
        Breaks a loop which this handle is working on. The loop may not be broken immediately on some OSes because of buffering or something. As a workaround, letting this capture some bogus packets after calling this method may work.
        Throws:
        NotOpenException
